body.p: Whenever a character is not covered by the font specified in the CSS, the Chemistry processor tries to use a fallback font. These fonts may or may be not available in the operating system.
Here is a list of fallback fonts that are automatically added for these popular font families:

ul.li: SansSerif - Segoe UI, DejaVu Sans, Microsoft YaHei, Yu Gothic, Malgun Gothic, Latha, Arial Unicode MS
Serif - Times, Times New Roman, DejaVu Serif, Symbol, SimSun, MingLiU, MS Mincho, Batang, Vijaya, Arial Unicode MS
Monospace - Segoe UI, DejaVu Sans Mono, SimSun, MingLiU, MS Mincho, Malgun Gothic, Latha, Arial Unicode MS

body.p: If you use the processor on multiple operating systems/machines, make sure you have a consistent list of fonts installed on each of them. For instance, if you are using a Linux and Windows machine to run transformations in parallel and the PDF produced on Linux has some missing characters (they are replaced with the # symbol), then you can fix this by inspecting the fonts listed in the Document Properties dialog box in the PDF reader and install them on the Linux machine (make sure you respect the licensing terms for the font).
